description: By far the most extensive front-end to different emulators. However, it is far from perfect as it will not run some roms. In this respect FCEUX is better (for NES as an example), PCSXR is better for PS1, PCSX2 is the only option for PS2 while there are no better alternatives for Sega Genesis. With that said, you'll be very happy RetroArch and I'll be surprise if you don't.

If you want your retrogames in a pretty interface, RetroArch delivers. Their "cores" are not as extensive as I would like (Higan is better in this regard), but otherwise it's a very solid front-end emulator.
Seemed a bit complicated but it was really easy, worked like a charm.

After a hour of moving in circles i was so confused that i give up. Its easier for me to download, install and configure several emulators in directories of their own and use them at will. For me, RetroArch seems to be the product of Windows 10 or automotive gui designers.

description:
Whenever I try to run the app on an updated version of Manjaro, Retroarch just doesn't run. When I run the program on the terminal, it gives me this error:

WARNING: cgroup v2 is not fully supported yet, proceeding with partial confinement

/snap/retroarch/702/usr/local/bin/retroarch: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.33' not found (required by /var/lib/snapd/lib/gl/libEGL.so.1)

Other than that, it's a great app for the time iv'e been using it, but this problem needs to be fixed.
summary: Program breaks in newer version of Manjaro

description: Good app for emulating a little bit of learning but this is Linux son xD

As per a dev on reddit, retroarch has no 64-bit arm linux core builds, so you can download and run retroarch, but you can't load any cores for it. If you're trying to run this on ubuntu on raspberry pi, use the 32-bit version of ubuntu.
summary: There are no 64-bit arm cores avalible

description: OK so on installing it forPi4 arm64 distro there's no cores available for this build. But all you need to do is download a copy of Lakka's Pi4 64bit nightly, unsquash it's SYSTEM FS and pull the cores from there. Retroarch will start supporting arm64/aarch64 linux soon, but in the short term, this is a pretty quick n painless resolve.
summary: works here, if you go core hunting

description: Works as intended.

This works really great as a snap, however one thing to remember is that it might not work with every core - for example I've had the snap installed for over a year and the flycast core does not work at all and no matter how often it gets updated it doesn't work. Possibly due to the way it can't access vulkan (maybe?). So if you're looking for that, you're better off using the official PPA. However, for other cores I've tried (e.g. MAME, PSX, SNES, NES, etc) everything works great.

Tried to download some cores and set up my gamepad. The gamepad works in the menu, but as soon as I load an SNES ROM, the controller stops responding and doesn't even work in the menu until I restart the controller. This has been the case with TWO wireless controllers. One, a Logitech F710 that connects via a dongle and an Xbox One gamepad that connects through Bluetooth. Both work fine on any other app in my system.

Nice job providing a snap version, but unfortunatelly the gamepads will not work with it (even though they do work with the apt version). The UI has several references to Windows, it gives the impression something is wrong with the build.
windows fans aka tv behave
remote aint working
I love this app.You can use it on almost every device.It provides space to put games and it has games on it.Try it!
summary: This app is for pro gamers+Early gamers!

description: I start RetroArch and it just gives me a RetroArch window with a black screen. I found a solution for it though (I think) If anyone else has trouble, open terminal and enter this command: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:libretro/stable && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install retroarch
It takes a little while to get everything setup. And even still you will have to make some tweaks here and there... At that point..... IT'S PERFECT!

I like RetroArch, but for some reason, the Linux version of it and even having it installed through Steam on Linux is not allowing me to access my content that I have on another drive that I have just for gaming. It is only allowing me access to the boot drive for Linux since that is what it is installed on. The only way that it looks like I can use RetroArch is through Windows, where the Windows client does actually see the external drives. I have Windows installed on a virtual machine so that I can use it for what I can't use Linux for.
summary: RetroArch is a great platform, but doesn't recognize extra drives

description:
I experienced similar frustration, but was able to find the appropriate command to fix the issue. I have my OS installed on an SSD but all my retroarch content disk mounted to /media. Retroarch could not view this content. I was able to find that you can give retroarch permission to view "removable media": $snap connect retroarch:removable-media . The content then became accessable.

That said, I have run into many other problems with this program. Some cores don't seem to run.

muy bueno solo que me enrredo todavia con los roms
muy bueno!!!!!!!

He podido correr roms de Atari, NES (Nintendo Entertainment System), PS1 (Play Station 1) entre otros que están hackeados. 

Lo que no me gustó fue que la configuración si cambias ciertas cosas, no las vas a poder deshacer, si ya lo hiciste no hay marcha atrás, así como los emuladores, ya que si los extraes no los vas a poder borrar a menos que desinstales y vuelvas a instalar Retroarch, así que debes de tener cuidado con lo que descargas y cambias. Por cierto, de nada sirve que lo vuelvas a poner a configuración de fabrica porque te pone en ingles todo y se pierde la liga de la carpeta personal de tu computadora y solo ubicándola desde la root encontrarás tu carpeta. 

Por cierto, debes de ser muy preciso con el emulador que usas para que los puedas correr, pues si no son del emulador que necesita la rom, te mandará error o se cerrará la aplicación.
It doesn't work on Nvidia Jetson Nano. No funciona en Jetson nano.

Saludos!

Tal vez esta sea una de las sugerencias que menos sirve, pues se supone que cada uno de los distritos linux tienen su soporte técnico; este programa no funciona, al instalarlo de cualquier manera, siendo la versión nightly, que anteriormente funcionaba, ahora a dejado de cargar los núcleos, pues hace rato que trabajo con un CPU Atom 1.6 GHz y 2 Gb de ram en la cual ya había instalado, tiene errores, sí, pero no los tenia hasta hacerlo inservible, ademas no sé a quien más acudir; hay una pagina en español muy buena que se llama ubunlog.com, ahí ayudan a configurar tu ubuntu, o derivados. El punto es que junto con esta paginas y algunas otras mencionan que las computadoras de pocos recursos ya no está funcionando el VIDEO, sobretodo en linux, es uno de los factores que casi no se recupera, yo podría pensar que es por antigüedad del CPU, pero hasta la fecha actual encuentras en el mercado PC con estos recursos, esto pensando que se supone son LTS o estables, solo espero que al comprar el servicio de soporte técnico estos problemas no sucedan.
summary: Error en la carga de núcleos en Zorin OS Lite 15.2
